docs.lead_paragraph: AS the immortal Casey Stengel once observed of oral contracts, New Year's resolutions, even those uttered with the best of intentions, all too often are not ''worth the paper they're written on.'' So this year a cross section of people who live and work in the county were spared divulging their resolutions. Instead, they were asked, more specifically, ''What is the most meaningful thing, for better or for worse, that you will be involved in during 1986?'' The reactions to the question varied. Some found it easy, others said it was an extremely difficult question to answer. Some gave one reply but others gave more, usually wanting to give both a professional and a personal response. Together, the replies reflect Westchester's diversity and many of its strengths.

headline.main: LOOKING AHEAD TO 1986: A SPIRIT OF EXPECTATION
